entities.name: bathilda
entities.description: Bathilda is described as telling a story to mother about Aberforth and Albus. She describes the scene where Aberforth punched Albus in the face.

entities.name: aberforth
entities.description: Aberforth is described as shouting at Albus that it was all his fault that Ariana was dead and then punching him in the face.

entities.name: albus
entities.description: Albus is described as not defending himself when Aberforth punched him in the face. He is also described as being able to destroy Aberforth in a duel with his hands tied behind his back.

entities.name: ariana
entities.description: Ariana is mentioned as having been dead and it is implied that she was ill.

entities.name: muriel
entities.description: Muriel is described as happily listening to Bathilda's story and reacting with elation to the recitation of old scandals.

entities.name: doge
entities.description: Doge is described as sitting there and bleating feebly that Ariana had been ill.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as not knowing what to think or believe about the story told by Bathilda.

relationships.description: Aberforth punched Albus in the face.
Muriel listened to Bathilda's story about Aberforth and Albus.
Harry disagreed with Doge's claim that Ariana had been ill.
